thread.title: USU volleyball: Utah State plays host to Boise State on Tuesday at 7 p.m.
thread.title_full: USU volleyball: Utah State plays host to Boise State on Tuesday at 7 p.m.

title: USU volleyball: Utah State plays host to Boise State on Tuesday at 7 p.m.
text:
Published: Monday, Oct. 5 2015 1:25 p.m. MDT Updated: 1 hour ago 
Utah State women's volleyball plays host to Boise State on Kirby Court at the Wayne Estes Center on Tuesday at 7 p.m. The Aggies look to use the match to break out of a four-match slump and capture their first conference victory of the season. 
USU and BSU will meet for the 38th time, with the Broncos holding a narrow 19-18 lead in the all-time series. The teams split results last season with the home side picking up the win. Utah State's victory came in the 2014 season finale as the Aggies topped Boise State in five sets, despite trailing the Broncos statistically on paper. 
Utah State has had a rocky start to its league slate, falling in each of its first four conference matches. The Aggies are currently 4-14 overall on the year and 0-4 in the Mountain West. 
USU has hit .145 (709-387-2,222) as an offense this season and has been paced by its outsides in junior Kaylie Kamalu and sophomore Rachel Gale. The duo lead the team with 208 and 202 kills, averaging 3.15 and 3.11 kills per set, respectively. Because of injuries, junior Erica Moscoso and freshman Kassidy Johnson have shared the load at setter. Johnson leads the team with 7.54 assists per set (422) and is followed by Moscoso with 6.65 assists per set (173). 
Defensively, junior libero Hannah Gleason has kept rallies alive with a team-best 276 digs. Gleason has logged double-digit digs in all but four matches this season, including five matches with 20 or more. She is currently fourth in the league with 4.18 per set. Sophomore middle Carly Lenzen leads the Aggie block, totaling 60 on the year. Opponents have hit .215 so far this year against the Aggies, totaling 887 kills on 2,298 attempts with 393 errors. 
Boise State is currently 10-6 on the year, including a 2-2 mark in the Mountain West after sweeping UNLV (3-1) and Fresno State (3-2) last weekend. 
The Broncos boast the best offense in the league, hitting a Mountain West-best .266 with a league-best 868 kills on 2,098 attempts and 309 errors. Sophomore outside Sierra Nobley leads BSU and the Mountain West with 269 kills, averaging 4.64 per set. Senior setter Sarah Baugh directs the attack, totaling 714 assists and averaging a league-best 12.10 per set. 
Boise State is third in the league in digs, averaging 14.63 per set with sophomore libero Maddi Osburn leading the way with 274 and averaging 4.64 per set. Redshirt sophomore middle Kaitlyn Oliver leads the Bronco block with 52, while the team averages 1.88 per set, 10th in the Mountain West. Opponents have hit .212 against the Broncos this season, totaling 718 kills on 2,038 attempts with 285 errors. 
Following the match with BSU, Utah State wraps up its four-match home stand facing San Jos√© State on Saturday, Oct. 10, at 7 p.m. Kyle Cottam is the Assistant Athletic Director for Media Relations at Utah State University. Recommended Stories
